pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 118, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 193, 366, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Multiple Choice (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 246, 507, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 437, 285]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 286, 539, 317]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 337, 228, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 353, 115, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>+</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[129, 353, 601, 369]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 369, 907, 400]]<|/det|>
For each question there are four possible answers \(\mathbf{A}\) , \(\mathbf{B}\) , \(\mathbf{C}\) and \(\mathbf{D}\) . Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 400, 579, 415]]<|/det|>
Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 415, 277, 430]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 430, 868, 460]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 460, 327, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 476, 364, 491]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 492, 329, 507]]<|/det|>
You may use a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 507, 670, 523]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 565, 570, 615]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 40. Each correct answer will score one mark. Any rough working should be done on this question paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 455, 88]]<|/det|>
A student is taking some measurements.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 101, 707, 120]]<|/det|>
Which measurement is taken directly using a micrometer screw gauge?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 129, 133, 147]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 129, 735, 147]]<|/det|>
0.52 g/ mm² B 0.52 g/ mm³ C 0.52 mm D 0.52 mm²

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 175, 96, 194]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 175, 680, 193]]<|/det|>
Which graph represents an object that is moving at constant speed?

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 201, 841, 606]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 640, 96, 657]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 640, 678, 657]]<|/det|>
In which situation does object X have a greater mass than object Y?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 668, 134, 686]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 668, 860, 686]]<|/det|>
Object X is in a larger gravitational field than object Y and both have the same weight.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 694, 134, 712]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 694, 920, 727]]<|/det|>
Object X shows a greater resistance to change in motion than object Y and both experience the same resultant force.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 736, 134, 754]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 736, 796, 754]]<|/det|>
Object X has a lower density than object Y and both occupy the same volume.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 762, 134, 780]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 762, 912, 780]]<|/det|>
Object X moves at a greater speed than object Y and both possess the same kinetic energy.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 556, 89]]<|/det|> Which substance in the table has the lowest density? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 100, 589, 230]]<|/det|>
substancemass/gvolume/cm³
Anylon1.21.0
Bcotton1.51.0
Colive oil1.82.0
Dwater2.02.0
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 256, 96, 275]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 256, 406, 275]]<|/det|> Three simple machines are shown. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 287, 201, 305]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 312, 297, 444]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[479, 287, 496, 305]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 312, 592, 435]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[771, 287, 791, 305]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[660, 333, 907, 420]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 453, 260, 470]]<|/det|> moving soil with <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 470, 260, 486]]<|/det|> a wheelbarrow <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 453, 544, 470]]<|/det|> cutting string <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 470, 544, 486]]<|/det|> with scissors <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[712, 453, 863, 470]]<|/det|>
screwing a screw <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[712, 470, 863, 486]]<|/det|> with a screwdriver <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 500, 625, 520]]<|/det|> Which machines are an application of the moment of a force? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 529, 133, 548]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 529, 240, 548]]<|/det|> 1, 2 and 3 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[278, 529, 298, 548]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[310, 529, 425, 548]]<|/det|> 1 and 2 only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 529, 468, 548]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[473, 529, 593, 548]]<|/det|> 1 and 3 only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 529, 628, 548]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[631, 529, 656, 548]]<|/det|> 2 and 3 only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 574, 96, 593]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 574, 707, 593]]<|/det|> A spring, which obeys Hooke's law, has an unstretched length of \(10 \text{cm}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 604, 484, 623]]<|/det|> A load of \(20 \text{N}\) is suspended from the spring. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 635, 430, 653]]<|/det|> The new length of the spring is \(36 \text{cm}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 664, 475, 683]]<|/det|> What is the spring constant \(k\) of the spring? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 693, 133, 711]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 693, 245, 711]]<|/det|> 0.56 N/ cm <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 693, 300, 711]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 693, 411, 711]]<|/det|> 0.77 N/ cm <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 693, 470, 711]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[473, 693, 567, 711]]<|/det|> 1.3 N/ cm <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[616, 693, 636, 711]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[648, 693, 733, 711]]<|/det|> 1.8 N/ cm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 608, 89]]<|/det|>
A rocket is launched upwards from the surface of the Moon.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 665, 120]]<|/det|>
Hot gases are ejected downwards over a very short period of time.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 384, 150]]<|/det|>
Which statement is **not** correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 161, 134, 178]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 161, 504, 178]]<|/det|>
The rocket experiences a downward force.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 188, 134, 205]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 188, 492, 205]]<|/det|>
The rocket experiences an upward force.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 214, 131, 232]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 214, 792, 231]]<|/det|>
The total momentum of the hot gases is equal to the momentum of the rocket.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 240, 133, 257]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 240, 920, 272]]<|/det|>
The total momentum of the hot gases and rocket when the hot gases have been ejected is zero.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 298, 96, 316]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 298, 571, 316]]<|/det|>
Electrical energy may be obtained from nuclear fission.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 329, 576, 346]]<|/det|>
In which order is the energy transferred in this process?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 357, 133, 375]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 357, 656, 375]]<|/det|>
nuclear fuel \(\rightarrow\) generator \(\rightarrow\) reactor and boiler \(\rightarrow\) turbines

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 384, 133, 402]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 384, 656, 401]]<|/det|>
nuclear fuel \(\rightarrow\) generator \(\rightarrow\) turbines \(\rightarrow\) reactor and boiler

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 411, 133, 429]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 411, 656, 428]]<|/det|>
nuclear fuel \(\rightarrow\) reactor and boiler \(\rightarrow\) generator \(\rightarrow\) turbines

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 439, 133, 457]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 439, 656, 456]]<|/det|>
nuclear fuel \(\rightarrow\) reactor and boiler \(\rightarrow\) turbines \(\rightarrow\) generator

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|> A box of mass \(m\) slides down a slope of length \(l\) against a frictional force \(F\). It descends a vertical height \(d\). <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[265, 112, 730, 291]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 301, 920, 335]]<|/det|> As the box slides down the slope, it loses gravitational potential energy and it does work against the friction. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 346, 878, 365]]<|/det|> Which row gives the loss in gravitational potential energy and the work done against friction? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 375, 594, 522]]<|/det|>
loss in gravitational potential energywork done against friction
Amgd\(Fl\)
Bmgd\(Fd\)
C\(mgl\)\(Fl\)
D\(mgl\)\(Fd\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 109, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
A rope, connected to a pulley system and motor, is used to lift different objects through different distances. The time taken to lift each object is the same. The diagrams are not to scale.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 115, 465, 134]]<|/det|>
Which motor requires the greatest power?

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[134, 141, 860, 555]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 578, 106, 597]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 577, 920, 612]]<|/det|>
Which equation can be used to calculate the pressure at a depth \(h\) beneath the surface of a liquid?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 625, 138, 644]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 625, 220, 650]]<|/det|>
\(p = \frac{h}{\rho g}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[288, 625, 313, 644]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[320, 624, 386, 650]]<|/det|>
\(p = \frac{h\rho}{g}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 625, 473, 644]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[480, 625, 556, 648]]<|/det|>
\(p = h\rho g\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[616, 625, 641, 644]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[648, 625, 730, 648]]<|/det|>
\(p = \frac{1}{h\rho g}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 686, 106, 705]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 686, 504, 705]]<|/det|>
A liquid is evaporating. The liquid is not boiling.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 715, 645, 734]]<|/det|>
Which statement about the liquid is correct at an instant in time?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 744, 134, 763]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 744, 628, 763]]<|/det|>
Any molecule can escape, and from any part of the liquid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 771, 134, 789]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 771, 648, 789]]<|/det|>
Any molecule can escape, but only from the liquid's surface.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 797, 133, 816]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 797, 836, 816]]<|/det|>
Only molecules with enough energy can escape, and only from the liquid's surface.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 823, 133, 841]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 823, 804, 841]]<|/det|>
Only molecules with enough energy can escape, but from any part of the liquid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 109, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 895, 89]]<|/det|> A gas is contained in a sealed container in a laboratory. The temperature of the gas increases. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|> What happens to the average speed and what happens to the total kinetic energy of the gas molecules? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 147, 551, 273]]<|/det|>
average speedtotal kinetic energy
Adoes not changedoes not change
Bdoes not changeincreases

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 392, 134, 410]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 392, 195, 410]]<|/det|> 2.0J <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 392, 298, 410]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[310, 392, 376, 410]]<|/det|> 2000J <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 392, 468, 410]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 392, 556, 410]]<|/det|> 16 200J <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[616, 392, 636, 410]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 392, 759, 410]]<|/det|> 16 200 000J <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 438, 106, 457]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 438, 922, 471]]<|/det|> The diagram shows the apparatus used to measure the specific latent heat of vaporisation of water. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[346, 477, 648, 600]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 612, 732, 631]]<|/det|> After the water begins to boil, \(110\mathrm{g}\) of water is converted to steam in \(120\mathrm{s}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 643, 843, 660]]<|/det|> Using these results, what is the value of the specific latent heat of vaporisation of water? Two angles, \(p\) and \(q\), are marked on the diagram. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 114, 685, 257]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 268, 860, 288]]<|/det|> Which row gives the angle of incidence and states whether total internal reflection occurs? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 297, 440, 444]]<|/det|>
angle of incidencetotal internal reflection
A\(p\)no
B\(p\)yes

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 471, 104, 490]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 471, 401, 490]]<|/det|> The letter F is reflected in a mirror. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 497, 566, 625]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 640, 437, 658]]<|/det|> What does the optical image look like? <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[240, 666, 756, 752]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 107, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 463, 89]]<|/det|> The Sun emits infrared radiation and light. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 532, 120]]<|/det|> Light from the Sun reaches the Earth in 8 minutes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 650, 149]]<|/det|> Which row gives correct information about the infrared radiation? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 161, 767, 306]]<|/det|>
wavelength of
